0.Pros: The coworkers are kind and the hours are very flexible. Discipline with customer service is one of the biggest things you learn.
0.Cons: The amount of work you do for the amount of pay you receive is not in equilibrium. The customers are rude and demanding.

1.Pros: Flexable schedule, growth in responsibility and understanding of jobs. This is a great job for a student or someone looking to enhance there job skills.
1.Cons: Working holidays, okay pay for starting off job. Not a good career.

2.Pros: This was a good place to develop my costumer service skills as well as in a fast paced environment. Good job to start off and obtain experience in different aspects of a working environment.
2.Cons: There was a lot of favoritism and employees who thrived to do their best and advance had a hard time doing so.

3.Pros: The smell. The lunch vouchers. The happy children eager to receive their happy meals. I loved working there ❤️
3.Cons: Really fast paced at peak times. The smell. You went home smelling like fries and grease, but hey at least you got paid for it. The lunch vouchers. I gained 10 pounds from working there in the first 2 months 😖. The children...the ones that were upset and throwing thing tantrums in public. Again, loved working there ❤️

4.Pros: The shifts can be either short or long. Long on the weekends, short on weekdays.
4.Cons: Low pay, managmemt can be all over the place with treatment of employees

5.Pros: Flexible Schedule, Good Working Environment, Always cooperated when a employee was having problems in certain areas, Always helpful
5.Cons: Bad pay, Raises rarely given, training could use some more interactive hands on type experience, need more professional looking uniforms

6.Pros: Meeting new people ,learning new things that i never done before. .
6.Cons: Working with people who have attitudes. Getting yelled at for something i didn't do..

7.Pros: The employees are great to work with when on the same page especially when working with children and any one.
7.Cons: Fast food. Rude customers. Mediocre pay. Weird scheduling. Pay raise. Human resources taking too long. Managers slack off a lot.

8.Pros: Great teamwork, Great Work Enviornment, Raises.
8.Cons: Lighten-Up. Don't be so uptight SANDY

9.Pros: Worked with a diverse group of people both racially and age wise, learned many skills in cooking, cleaning, and running a store. Great for learning cash handling skills.
9.Cons: Not always enough time to take a breath, have to go off the floor for a drink
